timeline.message:
feat: add healthcheck for reactive datasources

the datasource config had a health check enabled option which was only consumed by Agroal Datasource
and not the reactive ones. Let's use this option for reactive datasource too and send appropriate
check status when database is down.

I think this will always be in the IO thread
Is this still a problem even if we  mark the Health handler as blocking though? https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/1.3.0.Final/extensions/smallrye-health/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/smallrye/health/deployment/SmallRyeHealthProcessor.java#L106

replies.bodyText: If it's a problem then I suppose we would need a change to run the health checks (probably all, not just this one) in a different thread pool (which one?)

Is this still a problem even if we mark the Health handler as blocking though? https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/1.3.0.Final/extensions/smallrye-health/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/smallrye/health/deployment/SmallRyeHealthProcessor.java#L106

Thanks @jmartisk for the clarifications and pointers.

If it's a problem then I suppose we would need a change to run the health checks (probably all, not just this one) in a different thread pool (which one?)

Yes, I think so too. @cescoffier WDYT? Preferably we should do it in another followup PR. I can take it if given enough inputs.
replies.author: machi1990

replies.bodyText: +1 for moving this to another PR
replies.author: jmartisk

replies.bodyText:
yes, it's a blocking route. Still, a blocking route should not be blocked indefinitely.
I would recommend adding a timeout (10 seconds) because we may not answer at all. The client (Kubernetes) would get an HTTP timeout, but we would consume and waste one of the threads of the worker thread pool.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: Where should we ideally process it though? Does the health extension need to maintain its own thread pool or is there a common thread pool that would be appropriate to use?
replies.author: jmartisk

replies.bodyText:
@cescoffier I have added a 10s timeout.
+1 with @jmartisk question up there. Should help with the next step.

replies.bodyText: @cescoffier do you have sometime to have another look and see if all comments have been addressed? Thanks.
